reviews.review_text: Quake on steroids basicly. CryEngine 3 does a great job an makes Nexuiz a fast-paced shooter experience.  Buy it and play it with friends - let the LAN party concept be born again!

Ever wanted to play Quake, but didn't want to have as much fun? Well, here you go I guess. It's literally just an attempt to carbon-copy the arena shooter formula, which is admirable, but it's just not as tight and fast pased as classics like Unreal and Quake were. It is really visually impressive at least.
Whatever you do, do not buy this game. The multiplayer is dead, when it even works, and the game itself is... terrible.
It is like being launched, spinning into space at 10,000 miles per hour.

NEVER EVER BUY THIS GAME! FULL SOLDOUT! This game should be removed from Steam. Completly unplayable. No gameserver, so many random bugs causing crashes. Anyway - it's NOT even as half good as original Nexuiz was before Illfonic bought the title. It's shame that it even got into game bundles... If you're looking for pretty looking game in Quake-like style - better check out Xonotic, or if you want something more 'kind-of-realistic' then try Urban Terror.

I got this game for free with the purchase of my video card. This game is basically just an updated version of Unreal Tournament, which I have played plenty of in the past. If you are looking for a good looking FPS game that plays like UT, this is it. It's only multiplayer, so it gets repetitive and boring quickly, though.
I can absolutely garuntee you, this is the craziest, in your face game ever. In the history of mankind.

One of my absolute favorite games. I played the original Nexuiz and loved it. I have waited to get the new Nexuiz on steam for a bit now and am not dissapointed a single bit. It's better than I thought. If You like fast paced arena shooters, this is probably the best one there is.
Such a shame no one really plays it. :/

An arena shooter with a bit of a twist. In Nexuiz, matches are punctuated by the use of mutators which change the flow of the game. For instance, there is a mutator that lowers gravity allowing you to jump great distances, another that gives everyone sniper rifles and enforces one hit kills. In total, there are 100 mutators. They are the best aspect of Nexuiz, making matches unpredictable and exciting.  It is a multiplayer game at heart (you can only play bot matches single player) which makes the problems with the online all the more confounding. The hit detection is very suspect; you can be unleashing on an opponent but seemingly do no damage. There is a fair bit of lag usually, so it exacerbates the hit detection issues. The player base is tiny too, thus it can be very difficult to find matches.  It's good for a couple of hours play, not much more.
